alert.note: Alert for Meigs; Morgan; Perry; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 03 at 2:22PM EST until March 04 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky and southeast Ohio, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Boyd, Carter and Greenup. In southeast Ohio, Athens, Gallia, Jackson OH, Lawrence OH, Meigs, Morgan, Perry, Vinton and Washington. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain into this afternoon, followed by a round of showers and possible thunderstorms late this afternoon and this evening, could result in rainfall becoming excessive. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
